content: A self-titled album released in 1971 by what legendary English rock band, known for their symbol logos, is often referred to as the 'IV Album'?

I believe the album you're referring to is "Led Zeppelin IV," released by the English rock band Led Zeppelin in 1971. This album is often referred to as the "IV Album" due to its Roman numeral designation and is famous for its minimalist cover art, which features four symbols, one for each band member. The album is widely regarded as one of the greatest and most influential rock albums of all time, featuring classics like "Stairway to Heaven," "Black Dog," and "Rock and Roll."
